title: Review of graphic design history books
content:
Typophiles might be interested in reading Johanna Drucker's reviews of Meggs' and Hollis's graphic design histories. It's available for free online as part of the inaugural issue of _Design and Culture_.  
 [http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/berg/dgcj/2009/00000001/00000001](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020235330/http:/www.ingentaconnect.com/content/berg/dgcj/2009/00000001/00000001)
author: eliason

comments.content: Thanks for linking to this article, Craig, and for giving notice of a new design magazine.
You're welcome. I should probably also link to the organization behind the journal, which is the [Design Studies Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020235330/http:/www.designstudiesforum.org/).

Thanks for the heads-up, Craig.

_The Origins of Graphic Design in America_ by Ellen Mazur Thomson, 1997, is far and away the best "cultural studies" history of design I've come across.

Due credit to Meggs though, he established a canon, which enhanced the status of the profession.
